pageContext.claim: “There was no collusion. Everybody—virtually everybody's come out. Even if you look at a Senator Burr the other day said he's the head of the Committee on Intelligence in the Senate. He's the head and they asked him that question. He's from North Carolina. They asked him the question about collusion. ‘No, we found no collusion. We found no collusion.’”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is twisting Burr's words. The senator said his committee had no "hard evidence" of collusion but has disputed Trump's remarks by adding that "we have a lot of investigation left." Similarly, the special counsel investigation into potential collusion between Russia and Trump's campaign continues, and no conclusions have been announced.
